comments:
My assigned memory for compiling my project was too small, so I got an Java.lang.OutOfMemory-Error 
and compile aborted. After this exception eclipse takes 5 times more time to start up. In the MacOS-
activity-monitor a "System-Failiure" appears, stays for 10 to 15 sec, leaves and eclipse is ready (no 
System-Failiure). After exiting eclipse I get this from the console:

The output is not always the same. To get this above I just started and shutdown eclipse.
I had this problem already with 2.1.3 and now with M8. With a new installation of eclipse the problem is 
gone, but reappears if that exception occurs first time and stays. It also seems to my, that the whole 
eclipse slows down, but I am not sure about that.
The OS is 10.3.3 with Java 1.4.2

Part of the problem may be that on startup, eclipse tries to recompile the 
world.

I think this is not Mac specific (and not an SWT problem) but is a part of the 
whole slow startup problem.

Reassigning to equinox - sounds like bug 53718

Nothing to do with the runtime.  We may be a little slower on restart after an 
crash but never slower than first startup after a new install.  Suspect that 
the workspace is doing a full build.

Moving to Core to see if they have a more general answer for telling users what 
is going on or deferring the build.

A full build will be required after a crash, but this will not greatly affect
startup time.  The build will run in the background and can be cancelled by the
user from the progress view.  Other plugins might also be doing additional
processing because they have to recompute state that was lost.  This is all
expected.  The NPE is clearly a bug, but since it happened so long ago it is
likely no longer useful.  Please enter a bug against JDT core if you see this
NullPointerException in your log in a newer build (3.0 release or greater).
